definition: to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)

sentences.english: Then I realize that guilt does nothing to get me fitter.
sentences.chinese: 之後我意識到對於使我的身材更有型，負疚無濟於事。

sentences.english: Say “no” to the things you say “yes” to out of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 拒絕那些你因爲負疚而答應的事。

sentences.english: Oh sorry , the price is the last price, it's up to you.
sentences.chinese: 噢，負疚，這是最後的價格了，你看着辦吧。

sentences.english: Guilt-ridden, parents then indulge their children with gifts and indiscipline .
sentences.chinese: 負疚的雙親用禮物和放鬆管教來遷就孩子。

sentences.english: I'm very sorry for delay in delivery.
You often regret what you have done with a sense of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 經常追悔自己做過的事，有負疚感。

sentences.english: Oops. Sorry. I was thinking about someone else!
sentences.chinese: 噢，負疚，本人把你當成別的一小我了。

sentences.english: The guilt has begun to kick in but it merely serves to gird my loins.
sentences.chinese: 負疚感又來了，但這隻會有利我瘦身。

sentences.english: At last I owned my defeat to myself, and put the thing out of mind.
sentences.chinese: 我永遠也擺脫不了在蒙太尼這件事上的負疚感。
